DOC.brief_summary: The study hypothesis is a decreased muscle damage induced by exercises when low-level laser therapy is applied on body muscles before exercises.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Low-level Laser Therapy (808nm) on Marker of Muscle Damage
DOC.detailed_description: The study assessed males submitted to exercise to induce muscle damage. Creatine kinase levels in blood was quantified in order to identify the magnitude of muscle damage.
DOC.criteria: healthy males, physically active, aged between 2540 years. smoker, or under medicine as antiinflammatory and/or any drug that could affect normal and physiological conditions and lesion in upper limbs.
